Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the Act, medical device incident has the same meaning as in subsection (4).

Heading.TitleText: Assessments Ordered Under Section 21.31 of the Act

Subsection.Text: The Minister’s power to make an order under section 21.31 of the Act in respect of a medical device is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom the order is made shall be the holder of a medical device licence issued in respect of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall have reasonable grounds to believe that the benefits — or the risks to the health or safety of patients, users or other persons — that are associated with the device are significantly different than they were when the medical device licence was issued or amended.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, after examining the results of an assessment that was ordered under section 21.31 of the Act in respect of a medical device,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the holder of the medical device licence issued in respect of the device with the results of the examination; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that a summary of the results of the examination, together with a description of any steps that the Minister has taken or may take as a consequence of the examination, is published on the Government of Canada website.

Heading.TitleText: Activities Ordered Under Section 21.32 of the Act

Section.Text: The Minister’s power to make an order under section 21.32 of the Act in respect of a medical device is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person to whom the order is made shall be the holder of a medical device licence issued in respect of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall have reasonable grounds to believe that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: there are significant uncertainties relating to the benefits or adverse effects associated with the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensee is unable to provide the Minister with information that is sufficient to manage those uncertainties, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicable requirements of these Regulations, together with any terms and conditions that have been imposed on the medical device licence, do not allow for sufficient information to be obtained to manage those uncertainties; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister shall take into account the following matters:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the activities that the licensee will be ordered to undertake are feasible, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether there are less burdensome ways of obtaining additional information about the device’s effects on the health or safety of patients, users or other persons.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections 62.22 to 62.26.

Definition.Text: List of Medical Devices – Notification of Shortages means the List of Medical Devices – Notification of Shortages that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Liste d’instruments médicaux – avis de pénuries)
specified medical device means a medical device that belongs to a category of medical devices that is set out in the List of Medical Devices – Notification of Shortages. (instrument médical inscrit)

Section.Text: The Minister may add a category of medical devices to the List of Medical Devices – Notification of Shortages only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that a shortage of a device that belongs to the category presents or may present a risk of injury to human health.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2), (7) and (9), if a shortage of a specified medical device exists or is likely to occur, the manufacturer of the device and, in the case of a Class I device, the importer of the device shall each provide the following information to the Minister electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and contact information of the manufacturer and, if the information is provided by the importer, the name and contact information of the importer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licensed device, the medical device licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization issued under section 68.12, the authorization number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identifier of the device, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device, including, if applicable, the model name, in English and French;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the device and of its packaging and an indication of whether it is a single-use device;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date when the shortage began or is anticipated to begin;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the anticipated date when the manufacturer will be able to meet the demand for the device if that date can be anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the shortage; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of the information that the manufacturer or importer relied on to determine that a shortage of the device exists or is likely to occur.

Subsection.Text: If the manufacturer of a specified medical device decides to discontinue the sale of the device in Canada, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer or importer is required to provide only the information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (f) in respect of the shortage that results from the decision and shall also provide under subsection (1) the reason for the discontinuation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 4(a) does not apply to the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, subsections (1) and (2) do not remove the requirement for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a manufacturer that is the holder of a medical device licence to inform the Minister under subsection 43(3); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a manufacturer that is the holder of an authorization issued under section 68.12 to inform the Minister under section 68.25.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (8), the information that is required under subsection (1) shall be provided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the manufacturer or importer did not anticipate the shortage, within five business days after the day on which the manufacturer or importer becomes aware of it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the manufacturer or importer anticipates that there will be a shortage, within five business days after the day on which the manufacturer or importer anticipates it.

Subsection.Text: If any of the information that was provided under subsection (1) changes, the manufacturer or importer shall provide the new information to the Minister electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister within two business days after the day on which the manufacturer or importer makes or becomes aware of the change.

Within two business days after the day on which the manufacturer is again able to meet the demand for the specified medical device, the manufacturer or importer shall notify the Minister electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister of the manufacturer’s ability to do so.

The manufacturer or importer need not provide the information that is required under subsection (1) if, within the applicable period referred to in paragraph (4)(a) or (b), the manufacturer or importer anticipates that the manufacturer will be able to meet the demand for the specified medical device within 30 days after the day on which the manufacturer or importer anticipated or became aware of the shortage.

Despite subsection (7), if the manufacturer or importer subsequently concludes that the manufacturer will be unable to meet the demand within the 30-day period, the manufacturer or the importer shall provide the information that is required under subsection (1) within five business days after the day on which the manufacturer or importer reaches that conclusion.
The manufacturer or importer need not provide the information that is required under subsection (1) if the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is also the manufacturer of another medical device that can be substituted for the specified medical device in respect of which a shortage exists or is likely to occur; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is able to meet the demand for the substitute medical device.

Subsection.Text: Despite section 62.23, the manufacturer of a specified medical device may permit the importer of the device to provide the information that is required under that section on the manufacturer’s behalf if the information that the manufacturer and importer must provide is identical.

The manufacturer shall notify the Minister electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister if the manufacturer has permitted the importer to provide the information on the manufacturer’s behalf.
The Minister shall publish, on the Government of Canada website, the information that the Minister receives under section 62.23, other than the information referred to in subparagraph 62.23(1)(i).
Subsection (1) does not apply if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that a situation, in respect of which information was provided under section 62.23, does not constitute a shortage.

The Minister may request that the manufacturer of a medical device — or any importer or distributor of a medical device — provide the Minister with information that is in their control if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is a shortage or risk of shortage of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a shortage of the device presents or may present a risk of injury to human health;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the information is necessary to establish or assess

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the existence of a shortage or risk of shortage of the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reason for a shortage or risk of shortage of the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the effects or potential effects on human health of a shortage of the device, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: measures that could be taken to prevent or alleviate a shortage of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer, importer or distributor will not provide the information without a legal obligation to do so.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer, importer or distributor shall provide the requested information electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister within the time limit specified by the Minister.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections 62.28 to 62.32.

Definition.Text: designated medical device means a medical device that is set out in the List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale. (instrument médical désigné)

List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale means the List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Liste d’instruments médicaux destinés aux importations et aux ventes exceptionnelles)

Section.Text: The Minister may add a medical device to the List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is a shortage or risk of shortage of another medical device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the device to be added to that list can be substituted for the device referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: The holder of an establishment licence may import a designated medical device if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder provides the Minister, electronically in a format specified by or acceptable to the Minister and not later than the fifth business day before the day on which the designated medical device is imported, with a notification that contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder’s name and contact information,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of the designated medical device,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: its name and the name of each of its components, parts and accessories, including, if applicable, the model name,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the name and contact information of the manufacturer of the device as it appears on the device label,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the name and address of the establishment where it is manufactured, if different from the information referred to in clause (C), and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: a detailed description of the medical conditions, purposes and uses for which it is manufactured, sold or represented, as well as its performance specifications if those specifications are necessary for proper use,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended port of entry into Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the estimated date of arrival of the shipment of the designated medical device, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the total number of units of the designated medical device that are intended to be imported on the date referred to in subparagraph (iv);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the designated medical device is authorized to be sold by a regulatory agency within its jurisdiction or, if the device is not required to be authorized by a regulatory agency within its jurisdiction, the device complies with the applicable legal requirements within its jurisdiction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the following information is set out in the List of Medical Devices for Exceptional Importation and Sale in respect of the designated medical device:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its class,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of its manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the establishment licence number of the holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the regulatory agency referred to in paragraph (b), and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which it may no longer be imported;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total number of units of the designated medical device that the holder imports does not exceed the maximum limit specified in the list referred to in paragraph (c) in respect of the device, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the designated medical device is imported on or before the date referred to in subparagraph (c)(vi); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has prepared a plan that specifies the measures to be taken in order for the holder to comply with section 62.32.

Section.Text: Sections 21 to 21.2 and 26 do not apply to the importation, under section 62.29, of a designated medical device by the holder of an establishment licence.

Subsection.Text: The provisions of these Regulations — other than this section and sections 44 to 62.2, and 62.32 to 65.1 — do not apply to the sale of a designated medical device that is imported under section 62.29.
Subsection (1) ceases to apply to the sale of a designated medical device on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the designated medical device, if the device has one, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the end of the two-year period that begins on the day that follows the date referred to in subparagraph 62.29(c)(vi).

Subsection.Text: The holder of an establishment licence shall not sell a designated medical device that they imported under section 62.29 unless they ensure that the information referred to in clause 62.29(a)(ii)(E) is available in English and French and in a manner that permits the safe use of the device.

Subject to subsection (3), the holder shall ensure that the information is available in accordance with subsection (1) until at least the end of the day on the latest expiry date of the designated medical devices that they imported.

If the designated medical device does not have an expiry date, the holder shall ensure that the information is available in accordance with subsection (1) until at least the expiration of the period that corresponds to the projected useful life of whichever of the devices that they imported has the latest projected useful life.

Section.Text: Sections 64 and 65 do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a retailer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a health care facility in respect of a medical device that is distributed for use within that facility.

Section.Text: The manufacturer and the importer of a medical device shall, on or before undertaking a recall of the device, each provide the Minister with the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device and its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer and importer, and the name and address of the establishment where the device was manufactured, if different from that of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reason for the recall, the nature of the defectiveness or possible defectiveness and the date on and circumstances under which the defectiveness or possible defectiveness was discovered;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an evaluation of the risk associated with the defectiveness or possible defectiveness;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the number of affected units of the device that the manufacturer or importer

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: manufactured in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: imported into Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sold in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the period during which the affected units of the device were distributed in Canada by the manufacturer or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each person to whom the affected device was sold by the manufacturer or importer and the number of units of the device sold to each person;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any communication issued with respect to the recall;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed strategy for conducting the recall, including the date for beginning the recall, information as to how and when the Minister will be informed of the progress of the recall and the proposed date for its completion;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed action to prevent a recurrence of the problem; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and telephone number of the representative of the manufacturer or importer to contact for any information concerning the recall.

Section.Text: The manufacturer and the importer of a medical device shall, as soon as possible after the completion of a recall, each report to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the recall; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the action taken to prevent a recurrence of the problem.

Subsection.Text: Despite sections 64 and 65, the manufacturer of a medical device may permit the importer of the device to prepare and submit, on the manufacturer’s behalf, the information and documents with respect to the recall if the information and documents that the manufacturer and importer must submit are identical.

The manufacturer shall advise the Minister in writing if the manufacturer has permitted the importer to prepare and submit the information and documents with respect to the recall on the manufacturer’s behalf.
Subject to section 68, the manufacturer of an implant shall provide, with the implant, two implant registration cards that contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of any person designated by the manufacturer for the collection of implant registration information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a notice advising the patient that the purpose of the cards is to enable the manufacturer to notify the patient of new information concerning the safety, effectiveness or performance of the implant, and any required corrective action; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement advising the patient to notify the manufacturer of any change of address.

Subsection.Text: An implant registration card shall be designed for the recording of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device, its control number and its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the health care professional who carried out the implant procedure;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the device was implanted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the health care facility at which the implant procedure took place; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the patient’s name and address or the identification number used by the health care facility to identify the patient.

Subsection.Text: The two implant registration cards referred to in subsection (1) shall be printed in both official languages; however, the manufacturer may choose to provide four cards, two in English and two in French.

Subject to subsection (2), a member of the staff of the health care facility where an implant procedure takes place shall, as soon as possible after the completion of the procedure, enter the information required by subsection 66(2) on each implant registration card, give one card to the implant patient and forward one card to the manufacturer of the implant or the person designated pursuant to paragraph 66(1)(b).

The patient’s name and address shall not be entered on the implant registration card forwarded to the manufacturer or person designated pursuant to paragraph 66(1)(b) except with the patient’s written consent.

The health care facility, the manufacturer or the person designated pursuant to paragraph 66(1)(b) shall not disclose the patient’s name or address, or any information that might identify the patient, unless the disclosure is required by law.
The manufacturer of an implant may apply in writing to the Minister for authorization to use an implant registration method other than the implant registration cards described in section 66.

The Minister shall authorize the use of the implant registration method proposed in the application referred to in subsection (1) if the Minister determines that the method will enable the manufacturer to achieve the purpose set out in paragraph 66(1)(c) as effectively as the use of implant registration cards.

Where an authorization has been granted pursuant to subsection (2), the manufacturer shall implement the alternative implant registration method, and sections 66 and 67 shall apply with such modifications as are necessary.

Heading.Label: PART 1.1
Heading.TitleText: Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: authorization means, unless the context requires otherwise, an authorization that is issued under section 68.12. (autorisation)

List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need means the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Liste d’instruments médicaux pour des besoins urgents en matière de santé publique)

List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use means the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (Liste d’instruments médicaux destinés à un usage élargi)
UPHN medical device means any of the following medical devices for an urgent public health need:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a medical device that is set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need and that is manufactured, sold or represented for use in relation to the corresponding medical condition that is set out in column 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a medical device that belongs to a category of medical devices that is set out in column 2 of Part 2 of that list and that is manufactured, sold or represented for use in relation to the corresponding medical condition that is set out in column 1. (instrument médical BUSP)

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs 68.21(1)(h), (i) and (j), and sections 68.24, 68.3, 68.31 and 68.34, a medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization is considered not to be a UPHN medical device if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the device is not set out in column 2 of Part 1 of the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need and does not belong to a category of medical devices that is set out in column 2 of Part 2 of that list; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the device is set out in column 2 of Part 1 of that list or belongs to a category of medical devices that is set out in column 2 of Part 2 of that list but is not authorized in relation to a corresponding medical condition that is set out, as the case may be, in column 1 of Part 1 or column 1 of Part 2.

Subsection.Text: This Part applies to medical devices that are not subject to Part 2 or 3.

Heading.TitleText: Non-application of Part 1 — Importation and Sale

Subsection.Text: Despite section 8, Part 1 does not apply in respect of the importation or sale of a medical device if the manufacturer holds an authorization for the device.
However, the following provisions of Part 1 apply in respect of the importation or sale of the medical device:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an importer, sections 59 to 61;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an importer or distributor, sections 44 to 51.1; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sections 21, 23 and 27, 52 to 58, 62 and 62.21 to 65.1.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (2)(b), subsection 44(3) does not apply if the medical device that is imported is a Class I device and the person from whom the device is imported is the manufacturer.

Heading.TitleText: Advertising — Authorized Class I Medical Device

Section.Text: No person shall advertise for the purpose of sale a Class I medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization if the device has been subjected to a change described in section 68.13 unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer holds an amended authorization; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the advertisement is placed only in a catalogue that includes a clear and visible warning that the devices advertised in the catalogue may not have been authorized in accordance with Canadian law.

Section.Text: In sections 68.06 to 68.09, authorized, in relation to a medical device, means that the device is the subject of an authorization.

If a system is authorized, all of its components or parts that are manufactured by the manufacturer of the system are deemed, for the purposes of its importation, sale or advertisement, to be authorized.

If a test kit is authorized, all of its reagents or articles that are manufactured by the manufacturer of the test kit are deemed, for the purposes of its importation, sale or advertisement, to be authorized.

If a medical device or medical device group is authorized and forms part of a medical device family or medical device group family, as the case may be, all other medical devices or medical device groups in the family are deemed to be authorized.

Subsection.Text: If all the medical devices that form part of a medical device group are authorized, that medical device group is deemed to be authorized.
If a medical device group is authorized, all the medical devices that form part of the medical device group are deemed, for the purposes of its importation, sale or advertisement, to be authorized.
The Minister may add a medical condition to column 1 of Part 1 or Part 2 of the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the medical condition presents, or is the result of, a significant risk to public health in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediate action is required to deal with the risk.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may add a medical device to column 2 of Part 1 of the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is an urgent public health need for the device that is related to the corresponding medical condition that is set out in column 1.

The Minister may add a category of medical devices to column 2 of Part 2 of the List of Medical Devices for an Urgent Public Health Need only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is an urgent public health need for the devices that belong to that category that is related to the corresponding medical condition set out in column 1.
A manufacturer of a medical device may submit to the Minister an application for an authorization for the device if it is a UPHN medical device.

The application shall be submitted in a form established by the Minister. The application shall contain sufficient information and documents to enable the Minister to determine whether to issue the authorization, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the class of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identifier of the device, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer as it appears on the device label;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the establishment where the device is manufactured, if different from those referred to in paragraph (d);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the medical conditions, purposes and uses for which the device is manufactured, sold or represented;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: information respecting the safety and effectiveness of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that establishes that the manufacturer has a quality management system in place in respect of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use, unless directions are not required for the device to be used safely and effectively;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation by the manufacturer that documented procedures are in place in respect of distribution records, complaint handling, incident reporting and recalls; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the device label.

Subsection.Text: An application in respect of a Class III or IV medical device shall contain, in addition to the information and documents referred to in subsection (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the materials used in the manufacture and packaging of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the countries, other than Canada, where the device has been sold, the total number of units sold in those countries and a summary of any reported problems with the device and any recalls of the device in those countries.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2) and subsection (3), the application need not include the information and documents referred to in paragraphs (2)(g) and (h) and, if applicable, subsection (3) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application includes information that demonstrates that an authorization or licence for sale of the medical device has been issued by a regulatory agency and that the authorization or licence has not been suspended or revoked; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the regulatory agency appears in the List of Regulatory Agencies for the Purposes of Subsection 68.11(4) of the Medical Devices Regulations, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time.

Section.Text: The Minister shall issue an authorization for a medical device if the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer has submitted an application to the Minister that meets the requirements set out in section 68.11;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with the device outweigh the risks associated with it, having regard to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the urgent public health need for the device or the absence of any such need;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the manufacturer has a quality management system in place that is adequate to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: control the quality and, if applicable, the purity and sterility of the device and the materials used in the manufacture of the device, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the device meets the specifications of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the health or safety of patients, users or other persons will not be unduly affected by the device.

Section.Text: No person shall import or sell a medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization if the device has been the subject of any of the following changes unless the manufacturer holds an amended authorization:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class III or IV device, a significant change;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change that would result in a change of the class of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a change in the name of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a change in the name of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a change in the identifier of the device, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class I or II device, a change in the medical conditions, purposes or uses for which the device is manufactured, sold or represented.

Section.Text: An application to amend an authorization shall be submitted to the Minister by the holder of the authorization in a form established by the Minister. The application shall contain sufficient information and documents to enable the Minister to determine whether to amend the authorization, including the information and documents referred to in subsection 68.11(2) and (3) that relate to the change referred to in section 68.13 for which an amendment to the authorization is required.
The Minister shall amend an authorization for a medical device if the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the authorization has submitted an application to the Minister that meets the requirements set out in section 68.14;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with the device outweigh the risks associated with it, having regard to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the urgent public health need for the device or the absence of any such need; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the health or safety of patients, users or other persons will not be unduly affected by the device.

Section.Text: The Minister may refuse to issue or amend an authorization for a medical device if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the manufacturer has contravened these Regulations or any provision of the Act relating to medical devices;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the device is not labelled in accordance with sections 21 and 23; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer has not submitted to the Minister all information, documents or material that was requested under section 68.23 to enable the Minister to determine whether to issue or amend the authorization, within the time limit specified in the request.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to amend an authorization for a medical device if the effect of the proposed amendment would be that the device would not be authorized in relation to at least one of the following medical conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a medical condition that qualified the device as a UPHN medical device when the application for the authorization was submitted under section 68.11;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a medical condition in relation to which the device was authorized when the application to amend the authorization was submitted under section 68.14, in the case where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of the authorization previously submitted an application to amend the authorization under section 68.14 to have the device authorized in relation to the medical condition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical condition qualified the device as a UPHN medical device when that previous application was submitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the authorization was amended under section 68.15 on the basis of that previous application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a medical condition in relation to which the device was not authorized when the application to amend the authorization was submitted under section 68.14, in the case where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of the authorization submitted the application to have the device authorized in relation to the medical condition, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical condition qualified the device as a UPHN medical device when the application was submitted.

Section.Text: If the Minister refuses to issue or amend an authorization, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer of the medical device in writing of the reasons for the refusal and give them an opportunity to be heard.
The Minister may, at any time, impose terms and conditions on an authorization for a medical device or amend those terms and conditions.
Despite section 68.03, the holder of an authorization for a medical device may submit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class I device, an application under section 45 for an establishment licence that would authorize the holder to sell or import the device; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class II, III or IV device, an application under section 32 for a licence for the device.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may cancel an authorization for a medical device by written notice to the holder, giving reasons, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the holder has contravened these Regulations or any provision of the Act relating to medical devices;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the risks associated with the device outweigh the benefits associated with it, having regard to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the urgent public health need for the device or the absence of any such need;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the holder does not have a quality management system in place that is adequate to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: control the quality and, if applicable, the purity and sterility of the device and the materials used in the manufacture of the device, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the device meets the specifications of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the health or safety of patients, users or other persons may be unduly affected by the device;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the holder has failed to comply with the terms and conditions of the authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an authorization issued in respect of an application submitted on the basis of subsection 68.11(4), the Minister becomes aware that the authorization or licence for sale of the device that had been issued by the regulatory agency is suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has not submitted to the Minister all information, documents or material that was requested under section 68.23 to enable the Minister to determine whether to cancel the authorization, within the time limit specified in the request;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class I device that is not a UPHN medical device,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder does not, within 120 days after the day on which the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device, submit an application under section 45 for an establishment licence that would authorize the holder to sell or import the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister refuses to issue an establishment licence to the holder under section 47, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder withdraws the application referred to in subparagraph (i);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class II device that is not a UPHN medical device,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder does not, within 120 days after the day on which the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device, provide the Minister with a copy of a contract, signed by both the holder and a registrar recognized by the Minister under section 32.1, that meets the following conditions:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the contract indicates that the holder has begun the certification process to determine whether they have a quality management system that satisfies the standard referred to in paragraph 32(2)(f), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the contract is in effect when that period expires, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder does not, within two years after the day on which the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device, provide the Minister with a copy of the quality management system certificate referred to in paragraph 32(2)(f); or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class III or IV device that is not a UPHN medical device,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder does not, within 120 days after the day on which the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device, provide the Minister with a copy of a contract, signed by both the holder and a registrar recognized by the Minister under section 32.1, that meets the following conditions:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the contract indicates that the holder has begun the certification process to determine whether they have a quality management system that satisfies the standard referred to in paragraph 32(3)(j) or (4)(p), as the case may be, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the contract is in effect when that period expires, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder does not, within two years after the day on which the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device, provide the Minister with a copy of the quality management system certificate referred to in paragraph 32(3)(j) or (4)(p), as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: If a medical device ceases to be a UPHN medical device after an application for an authorization is submitted under section 68.11 but before the Minister issues the authorization under section 68.12, the reference to “the device ceases to be a UPHN medical device” in subparagraph (1)(h)(i), (i)(i) or (j)(i), as the case may be, shall be read as “the Minister issued the authorization”.
Subsection (1.1) ceases to apply in respect of the medical device if the device is authorized in relation to a medical condition that qualifies it as a UPHN medical device.

A ground for cancellation specified in subparagraph (1)(i)(i) or (j)(i) does not apply if the holder has already provided the Minister with a copy of the quality management system certificate referred to in paragraph 32(2)(f), (3)(j) or (4)(p), as the case may be, or a copy of the contract referred to in the applicable subparagraph.

A ground for cancellation specified in subparagraph (1)(i)(ii) or (j)(ii) does not apply if the holder has already provided the Minister with a copy of the quality management system certificate referred to in paragraph 32(2)(f), (3)(j) or (4)(p), as the case may be.

Section.Text: An authorization for a medical device is cancelled if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class I device, the holder of the authorization is issued an establishment licence under section 46 that authorizes the holder to sell or import the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class II, III or IV device, the holder of the authorization is issued a licence for the device under section 36; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the authorization informs the Minister under section 68.25 that the holder has discontinued the sale of the device in Canada.

Section.Text: The Minister may request that the manufacturer of a medical device who has submitted an application for an authorization or the holder of an authorization submit to the Minister, within a specified time limit, any additional information or documents or any material, including samples, that is necessary to enable the Minister to determine whether to issue, amend or cancel the authorization.

The holder of an authorization for a Class II, III or IV medical device that is not a UPHN medical device shall, annually before November 1 and in a form established by the Minister, provide the Minister with a statement signed by the holder or a person authorized to sign on the holder’s behalf

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: confirming that all the information and documents submitted by the holder with respect to the device are still correct; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describing any change to the information and documents submitted by the holder with respect to the device, other than those to be submitted under section 68.14 or 68.34.

Subsection.Text: This section applies to the holder of an authorization for a medical device that was issued in respect of an application submitted on the basis of subsection 68.11(4).

If the holder of an authorization for a medical device receives or becomes aware of information to the effect that the authorization or licence for sale of the device that was issued by the regulatory agency is suspended or revoked, the holder shall notify the Minister within 72 hours after they receive or become aware of the information, whichever occurs first.
However, the holder is not required to notify the Minister if they or the holder referred to in paragraph 68.3(1)(b) submits that information under section 68.3.

Section.Text: If the holder of an authorization for a medical device discontinues the sale of the device in Canada, the holder shall inform the Minister within 30 days after the discontinuance.
If the manufacturer of a medical device holds an authorization for the device, the importer of a shipment of the device shall ensure that the shipment is accompanied by a copy of the authorization.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an authorization for a medical device shall submit a preliminary report to the Minister in respect of any incident that comes to their attention occurring in Canada that involves the device

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within 10 days after becoming aware of the incident, if the incident has led to the death or a serious deterioration in the state of health of a patient, user or other person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within 30 days after becoming aware of the incident, if the incident has not led to the death or a serious deterioration in the state of health of a patient, user or other person but could do so were it to recur.

Subsection.Text: The preliminary report shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the medical device and its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of the holder and of any known importer of the medical device as well as the name, title and contact information of a representative of the holder to contact for any information concerning the incident;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the holder became aware of the incident;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the details known in respect of the incident, including the date on which the incident occurred and the consequences for the patient, user or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and contact information, if known, of the person who reported the incident to the holder;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the names of any other medical devices involved in the incident, including any accessories, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the preliminary comments of the holder with respect to the incident;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the course of action, including an investigation, that the holder proposes to follow in respect of the incident and a timetable for carrying out any proposed action and submitting a final report; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating whether a previous report has been made to the Minister with respect to the medical device and, if so, the date of the report.

Subsection.Text: The holder of the authorization shall, after making the preliminary report, submit a final report to the Minister in accordance with the timetable established under paragraph 68.27(2)(h).
The final report shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the incident, including the number of persons who have died or experienced a serious deterioration in the state of their health;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed explanation of the cause of the incident and a justification for the actions taken in respect of the incident; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any actions taken in respect of the medical device as a result of the investigation referred to in paragraph 68.27(2)(h), which may include

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: increased post-market surveillance of the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: corrective and preventive action respecting the design and manufacture of the device, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: recall of the device.

Section.Text: The holder of the authorization is not required to submit the preliminary report referred to in section 68.27 or the final report referred to in section 68.28 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information that the holder would be required to include in that preliminary report is identical to the information that the importer of the device is required to include in the preliminary report referred to in subsection 59(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information that the holder would be required to include in that final report is identical to the information that the importer of the device is required to include in the final report referred to in subsection 59(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder advises the Minister in writing that the importer of the device is submitting the preliminary report and the final report under subsection 59(1).

Heading.TitleText: Serious Risk of Injury to Human Health

Subsection.Text: This section applies to the following holders of therapeutic product authorizations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of an authorization for a Class II, III or IV medical device that is not a UPHN medical device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a holder of an establishment licence to import Class II, III or IV medical devices that imports a device referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The holder of a therapeutic product authorization shall submit to the Minister information in respect of any serious risk of injury to human health that the holder receives or becomes aware of and that is relevant to the safety of a device referred to in paragraph (1)(a), regarding

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: risks that have been communicated by any regulatory agency that is set out in the List of Regulatory Agencies for the Purposes of Sections 61.2 and 68.3 of the Medical Devices Regulations, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time, or by any person who is authorized to manufacture or sell a medical device within the jurisdiction of such a regulatory agency, and the manner of the communication;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: changes that have been made to the labelling of any medical device and that have been communicated to or requested by any regulatory agency that is set out in that list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recalls, reassessments and suspensions or revocations of authorizations, including licences, in respect of any medical device, that have taken place within the jurisdiction of any regulatory agency that is set out in that list.

Subsection.Text: The information shall be submitted to the Minister within 72 hours after the holder receives or becomes aware of it, whichever occurs first.

Despite subsection 68.3(2), if the holder of a therapeutic product authorization issued in respect of a medical device is the manufacturer, they may permit the importer of the device to submit the information required under that subsection on the manufacturer’s behalf if the information that the manufacturer and the importer must submit is identical.
The manufacturer shall advise the Minister in writing if the manufacturer has permitted the importer to submit the information on the manufacturer’s behalf.
The holder of an authorization for a Class II, III or IV medical device that is not a UPHN medical device shall prepare

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class II device, on a biennial basis, a summary report of the information referred to in subsection (2) that the holder received or became aware of during the previous 24 months; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class III or IV device, on an annual basis, a summary report of the information referred to in subsection (2) that the holder received or became aware of during the previous 12 months.

Subsection.Text: The information to be covered by the summary report is that in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adverse effects;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: problems referred to in paragraph 57(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: incidents referred to in subsection 68.27(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: serious risks of injury to human health that are relevant to the safety of the medical device and are referred to in subsection 68.3(1).

Subsection.Text: The summary report shall contain a concise critical analysis of the information referred to in subsection (2).

In preparing the summary report, the holder shall determine, on the basis of the critical analysis, whether what is known about the benefits and risks associated with the medical device has changed in any of the following ways:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the potential benefits for patients through the use of the device may be less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each of the risks,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the harm associated with the risk is more likely to occur, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the harm associated with the risk occurs, the consequences for the health or safety of patients, users or other persons could be more serious; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a new risk has been identified.

Subsection.Text: The holder shall include the conclusions they reach under subsection (4) in the summary report.

If, in preparing the summary report, the holder concludes that what is known about the benefits and risks associated with the medical device has changed in any of the ways referred to in paragraphs (4)(a) to (c), they shall notify the Minister, in writing, within 72 hours after having reached the conclusion, unless that has already been done.

The Minister may, for the purposes of determining whether there is sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with a medical device outweigh the risks, request that the holder of an authorization for the device submit, within a specified time limit, any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: summary reports; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information on the basis of which summary reports were prepared.

Subsection.Text: The holder shall submit to the Minister the summary reports or information, or both, that the Minister requests within the time limit specified in the request.
The holder of an authorization for a medical device shall maintain records of the summary reports and the information on the basis of which those reports were prepared.
The holder shall retain the records for seven years after the day on which they were created.

If a new or modified quality management system certificate is issued in respect of a medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization and that is not a UPHN medical device, the manufacturer shall submit a copy of the certificate to the Minister within 30 days after it is issued.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the manufacturer includes the new or modified quality management system certificate in an application to amend the authorization that is submitted under section 68.14.

Section.Text: Subject to sections 21, 23 and 44, if an authorization for a medical device is cancelled under paragraph 68.21(1)(h), (i) or (j), a person other than the manufacturer may sell the device, despite any other provision in Part 1, for a period of six months beginning on the day on which the authorization is cancelled.
The Minister may add a medical condition to column 1 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use only if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the medical condition presents, or is the result of, a significant risk to public health in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediate action is required to deal with the risk.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may add a licensed medical device, or a Class II, III or IV medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization, to column 2 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use and an expanded use to column 3 only if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that there is an urgent public health need for the expanded use of the device that is related to the corresponding medical condition that is set out in column 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sufficient evidence to support the conclusion that the benefits associated with the expanded use outweigh the risks associated with it, having regard to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the uncertainties relating to those benefits and risks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the urgent public health need for the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister determines that the health or safety of patients, users or other persons will not be unduly affected by the expanded use of the device.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a licensed medical device, sections 26 and 27, as they relate to an expanded use of the device, do not apply in respect of the importation, sale or advertisement of the device if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the medical condition to which the expanded use relates is set out in column 1 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the device is set out in column 2 of that list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expanded use of the device is set out in column 3 of that list.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a Class II, III or IV medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization, sections 27 and 68.13, as they relate to an expanded use of the device, do not apply in respect of the importation, sale or advertisement of the device if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the medical condition to which the expanded use relates is set out in column 1 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the device is set out in column 2 of that list; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expanded use of the device is set out in column 3 of that list.

Section.Text: The Minister shall publish on the Government of Canada website supplementary information pertaining to the expanded use, set out in column 3 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use, of a licensed medical device — or a Class II, III or IV medical device for which the manufacturer holds an authorization —, set out in column 2 of that list, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the expanded use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the known and potential benefits and risks; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any supplement to the directions for use, unless a supplement is not required for the device to be used safely and effectively.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may request from the holder of a medical device licence, in respect of the medical device that is set out in column 2 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use for which the licence was issued, any information in relation to the expanded use that is set out in column 3 of that list that the holder possesses or to which they have reasonable access.

The Minister may request from the holder of an authorization, in respect of the Class II, III or IV medical device set out in column 2 of the List of Medical Devices for Expanded Use for which the authorization was issued, any information in relation to the expanded use set out in column 3 of that list that the holder possesses or to which they have reasonable access.
The holder of the licence or authorization shall submit to the Minister the information that the Minister requests within the time limit specified in the request.

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Custom-Made Devices and Medical Devices to Be Imported or Sold for Special Access

Subsection.Text: This Part applies to custom-made devices and medical devices that are to be imported or sold for special access.
In this Part, special access means access to a medical device for emergency use or if conventional therapies have failed, are unavailable or are unsuitable.

Section.Text: No person shall import or sell a Class III or IV custom-made device or a medical device for special access unless the Minister has issued an authorization for its sale or importation.

Subsection.Text: If a health care professional wishes to obtain a medical device referred to in section 70, the professional shall apply to the Minister for an authorization that would permit the manufacturer or importer of the device to sell, or to import and sell, the device to that professional.
The application shall contain the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device, its class and its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units required;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and telephone number of the representative of the manufacturer or importer to contact for any information concerning the device;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the diagnosis, treatment or prevention for which the device is required;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons the device was chosen for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the risks and benefits that are associated with its use, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons the diagnosis, treatment or prevention could not be accomplished using

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a licensed medical device that is available for sale in Canada, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a medical device for which the manufacturer of that device holds an authorization issued under section 68.12 and that is available for sale in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each health care facility at which the device is to be used by that professional;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the known safety and effectiveness information in respect of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a written undertaking by the health care professional that the professional will inform the patient for whom the device is intended of the risks and benefits associated with its use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use, unless directions are not required for the device to be used safely and effectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a custom-made device, a copy of the health care professional’s written direction to the manufacturer giving the design characteristics of the device.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall issue an authorization referred to in subsection 71(1) to a manufacturer or importer if the Minister determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the benefits that may be obtained by the patient through the use of the device outweigh the risks associated with its use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the health or safety of patients, users or other persons will not be unduly affected;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed device that would adequately meet the requirements of the patient is not available in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: a medical device for which the manufacturer of that device holds an authorization issued under section 68.12 and that would adequately meet the requirements of the patient is not available for sale in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the authorization is not being used by the manufacturer or importer to circumvent the requirements of Part 1 or 1.1.

Subsection.Text: The authorization issued under subsection (1) shall specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units of the device authorized to be imported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units of the device authorized to be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the health care professional to whom the manufacturer or importer may sell the device.

Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application made pursuant to section 71 are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the conditions set out in subsection 72(1) have been met, the manufacturer, importer or health care professional shall, at the request of the Minister, submit any further information relevant to the application that the Minister may request.
The Minister may, in respect of an authorization that has been issued,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: request the manufacturer, importer or health care professional to submit information in respect of the device if the Minister believes on reasonable grounds, after reviewing a report or information brought to the Minister’s attention, that the device for which the authorization has been issued no longer meets the conditions set out in subsection 72(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: issue a written cancellation of the authorization, giving reasons, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister determines that the conditions set out in subsection 72(1) are no longer met, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraph (a) has not been submitted.

Section.Text: No person shall import or sell a medical device in respect of which an authorization has been issued pursuant to section 72, or a Class I or II custom-made device, unless the device has a label that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the name of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the name of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: specifies whether the device is a custom-made device or is being imported or sold for special access.

Section.Text: The manufacturer or importer of a medical device in respect of which an authorization has been issued pursuant to section 72 shall maintain a distribution record in respect of the device in accordance with sections 52 to 56.

The health care professional referred to in subsection 71(1) shall, within 72 hours after becoming aware of an incident that involves the medical device for which an authorization has been issued under section 72 and that meets the following conditions, report the incident to the Minister and to the manufacturer or importer of the device and specify the nature of the incident and the circumstances surrounding it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the incident is related to a failure of the device or a deterioration in its effectiveness or any inadequacy in its labelling or in its directions for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the incident has led to the death or a serious deterioration in the state of health of a patient, user or other person or could do so were the incident to recur.

Section.Text: Sections 66 to 68 apply in respect of an implant that is imported or sold for special access.

Heading.Label: PART 3
Heading.TitleText: Medical Devices for Investigational Testing Involving Human Subjects

Section.Text: This Part applies to medical devices that are to be imported or sold for investigational testing involving human subjects.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall import or sell a medical device for investigational testing.

A manufacturer or importer of a Class II, III or IV medical device may sell the device to a qualified investigator for the purpose of conducting investigational testing if the manufacturer or importer holds an authorization issued under subsection 83(1) and possesses records that contain all the information and documents required by section 81.

A manufacturer or importer of a Class I medical device may sell the device to a qualified investigator for the purpose of conducting investigational testing if the manufacturer or importer possesses records that contain all the information and documents required by section 81.

Section.Text: The records referred to in section 80 shall contain the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the manufacturer and the importer of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the device, its class and its identifier, including the identifier of any medical device that is part of a system, test kit, medical device group, medical device family or medical device group family;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the device and of the materials used in its manufacture and packaging;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the features of the device that permit it to be used for the medical conditions, purposes and uses for which it is manufactured, sold or represented;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the countries other than Canada where the device has been sold, the total number of units sold in those countries, and a summary of any reported problems with the device and any recalls of the device in those countries;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a risk assessment comprising an analysis and evaluation of the risks, and the risk reduction measures adopted for the purposes of conducting investigational testing of the device, including, as appropriate,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of any previous research, testing and studies conducted with respect to the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the methods currently used to diagnose or treat the medical condition in respect of which the investigational testing is being proposed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting any cautions, warnings, contra-indications and possible adverse effects associated with the use of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the names of all the qualified investigators to whom the device is proposed to be sold and their qualifications, including their training and experience;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each institution at which the investigational testing is proposed to be conducted and, in the case of a Class III or IV device, written approval from the institution indicating that the investigational testing may be carried out there;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a protocol of the proposed investigational testing, including the number of units of the device proposed to be used for the testing, the hypothesis for and objective of the testing, the period of time during which the testing will be carried out and a copy of the patient consent form;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the device label; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a written undertaking from each qualified investigator to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct the investigational testing in accordance with the protocol provided by the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: inform a patient who is to be diagnosed or treated using the device of any risks and benefits associated with its use, and obtain the patient’s written consent for its use,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not use the device or permit it to be used for any purpose other than the investigational testing specified in the protocol,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: not permit the device to be used by any other person except under the direction of the qualified investigator, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the event of an incident involving the device and that meets the following conditions, report the incident and the circumstances surrounding it to the Minister and to the manufacturer or importer of the device within 72 hours after the qualified investigator becomes aware of the incident:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the incident is related to a failure of the device or a deterioration in its effectiveness or any inadequacy in its labelling or in its directions for use, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the incident has led to the death or a serious deterioration in the state of health of a patient, user or other person or could do so were the incident to recur.

Section.Text: An application for an authorization referred to in subsection 80(2) shall be made in writing to the Minister and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class II medical device or a Class III or IV in vitro diagnostic device that is not used for patient management, not including a near-patient in vitro diagnostic device, the information set out in paragraphs 81(a), (b) and (h) to (j); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Class III or IV medical device that is not covered by paragraph (a), the information and documents set out in section 81.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall issue an authorization referred to in subsection 80(2) to a manufacturer or importer if the Minister determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the device can be used for investigational testing without seriously endangering the life, health or safety of patients, users or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the investigational testing is not contrary to the best interests of patients on whom the testing will be conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the objective of the testing will be achieved.

Subsection.Text: The authorization referred to subsection (1) shall specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any qualified investigator to whom the device may be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of diagnosis or treatment for which the device may be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units of the device that are authorized to be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the protocol according to which the investigational testing is to be conducted.

Section.Text: If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application made pursuant to section 82 are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the conditions set out in subsection 83(1) have been met, the manufacturer or importer shall, at the request of the Minister, submit any further information relevant to the application that the Minister may request.
